content: SeedlyTV EP04 Robo-Advisors Investments Autowealth Endowus MoneyOwl Smartly Stashaway Asked by AnonymousAsked on 03 May 2019What are the reasons for the low returns for robo-advisors so far?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Tai Zhi, Chief Investment Officer at AutowealthLevel 4. ProdigyUpdated on 07 May 2019For a reasonably low-risk portfolio, AutoWealth Balanced Portfolio (40% govt bonds, 60% stocks) achieved 17.3% returns net of fees and currency impact since our inception 30 Apr 2016 to 31 Mar 2019 end of last available quarter. On an annualised basis, thats 5.9%. We have outperformed all 20 global balanced unit trusts available for sale in Singapore through Fundsupermart. You may check out our investment track record at the following url: https://www.autowealth.sg/strategy.phpIf you are looking for higher returns above that, our highest risk portfolio offering is AutoWealth Long Term Growth Portfolio (20% govt bonds, 80% stocks).0 comments0

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019I don't know what you mean by low. I have double digit paper gains so far. If you want returns like 25%, I suggest you buy the lottery instead.1 comment0
Jonathan Chia Guangrong05 May 201925% is very achievable via the US market. You just need to know how.

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 03 May 2019Define low. Robos are just mainly providing market returns minus fees.0 comments0
